DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Microscopic Analysis Criterion Histology Laboratory Test Result Not Fulfilled Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that describes the findings that do not meet microscopic analysis criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Pre-analytical Variables Program Microscopic Analysis Criterion Histology Laboratory Test Result Not Fulfilled
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens._Too small to be seen except under a microscope._Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._The outcome of a laboratory test._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.

Concepts.definition: A program designed to systematically investigate the effects of individual pre-analytical factors on the molecular profiles of biospecimens. The results of this study will be used to develop evidence-based protocols and best practices for optimal collection, processing, and storage of biospecimens.

Property.preferredName: Microscopic Analysis Criterion Histology Laboratory Test Result Negation Fulfill
Property.preferredDefinition: Too small to be seen except under a microscope.:Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. Concepts.definition: Too small to be seen except under a microscope.

Examination and interpretation; the process of identifying an issue to be understood and addressed, modelling the issue, investigating the model results, interpreting the results, and possibly making a recommendation. The concept also refers to the examination and study of a whole in terms of the parts composing it.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
The outcome of a laboratory test.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Satisfy the requirements or expectations of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
